12894.query: My family and I are planning a multilingual event and we need to know the language codes for different languages. Can you provide us with a list of language codes in ISO 639-1 format? Moreover, we would like to explore the supported languages and possible translations between them using the Translate it API.

available_tools.name: options_for_translate_it

available_tools.name: Finish
available_tools.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

answer.final_answer:
The language codes in ISO 639-1 format for the multilingual event and the Translate it API are as follows:

For the multilingual event:
- Abkhaz: ab
- Afar: aa
- Afrikaans: af
- and so on...

67969.query: My company is organizing a wellness program and we want to create individual user profiles. Please assist us in setting up user accounts using the Suggestic API. Also, we would like to explore exercises that target the biceps and provide instructions on how to perform them.

answer.final_answer:
To set up user accounts using the Suggestic API for the wellness program, you can utilize the "Create User" API within the Suggestic Food & Meal Plan tool. This API allows partners or clients to register their own users into the system. By providing essential user information such as name, email, dietary preferences, and other relevant details, partners or clients can customize the user experience on the platform. Successfully executing this API call will add the user to the Suggestic system, granting them access to tailored meal plans, dietary advice, and other functionalities offered by the Suggestic platform.

As for exercises that target the biceps and instructions on how to perform them, here are a few options:

1. Incline Hammer Curls: Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Let the dumbbells hang straight down at your sides, holding them with a neutral grip. Start the movement by flexing at the elbow while keeping the upper arm stationary. Go to the top of the movement, pause, then slowly return to the starting position.

2. Wide-grip barbell curl: Stand up with your torso upright, holding a barbell at the wide outer handle with your palms facing forward. Keep your elbows close to your torso. Curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps, making sure only the forearms move. Continue until your biceps are fully contracted, hold for a second, then slowly bring the bar back to the starting position.

3. EZ-bar spider curl: Set the EZ-bar on the part of the preacher bench and make sure it is balanced. Position yourself in front of the bench. Place your upper arms on the part where the arms usually lay. Curl the barbell towards your forehead while keeping your upper arms stationary. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

These exercises can effectively target the biceps and can be performed following the provided instructions.

1. Incline Hammer Curls: Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand. Let the dumbbells hang straight down at your sides, holding them with a neutral grip. Start the movement by flexing at the elbow while keeping the upper arm stationary. Go to the top of the movement, pause, then slowly return to the starting position.

2. Wide-grip barbell curl: Stand up with your torso upright, holding a barbell at the wide outer handle with your palms facing forward. Keep your elbows close to your torso. Curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps, making sure only the forearms move. Continue until your biceps are fully contracted, hold for a second, then slowly bring the bar back to the starting position.

3. EZ-bar spider curl: Set the EZ-bar on the part of the preacher bench and make sure it is balanced. Position yourself in front of the bench. Place your upper arms on the part where the arms usually lay. Curl the barbell towards your forehead while keeping your upper arms stationary. Slowly lower the bar back to the starting position. Repeat for the recommended number of repetitions.

These exercises can effectively target the biceps and can be performed following the provided instructions.

answer.final_answer:
To retrieve the list of bookable items available for the company event, you can use the Sagenda Free Booking System tool. This tool has a method called /Events/GetBookableItemList which provides a structured list of all bookable items currently available in the system. This list includes resources such as rooms, equipment, personnel, or services that can be booked, reserved, or scheduled for the event. It also includes details like availability, pricing, and booking conditions.

However, please note that the API response does not provide the list of friends attending the event. If you need to retrieve the list of friends attending the event, you may need to use a different method or tool that specifically handles attendee information.

pair_id.description:

available_tools.name: web_candles_for_open_defi
available_tools.description:
This is the subfunction for tool "open_defi", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Fetch candle data for a single trading pair.

You need to resolve the symbolic trading pair name to `pair_id` primary key with `/pairs` or `/pair-details`
to call this API endpoint.

Candle response size is limited to 10,000 candles. Only the first 10,000 "

time_bucket.description: What time bucket to use for the candle size.

pair_id.description:
Primary key for the trading pair

For tests and demos use id `1` which is ETH/USDC pair on Uniswap v2,
as it is the first deployed Uniswap v2 compatible pool.

start.description:
When the candle fetch period starts.

Use UNIX UTC timestamp, as ISO 8601 formatted string.
[Read more information about the time format](https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#datetime.datetime.fromisoformat).

If not specific this will be resol

end.description:
When the candle fetch period ends.

Use UNIX UTC timestamp, as ISO 8601 formatted string.

If not specific this will be resolved to now().

This range parameter is inclusive.

answer.final_answer:
The current monthly and annual inflation percentages for the Consumer Price Index (CPI) are as follows:

- Austria: Monthly inflation rate of 0.65% and annual inflation rate of 4.31%
- Belgium: Monthly inflation rate of 0.55% and annual inflation rate of 3.18%
- Other countries also have their respective monthly and annual inflation rates, but they are not specified in the logs.

The market capitalization of Bitcoin in US Dollars is $585.85 billion. However, the real-time volume of Bitcoin is not provided in the API response.

The company information for Amazon is as follows. Amazon.com, Inc. is located in the United States and operates in the Internet Retail industry within the Consumer Cyclical sector. The company's symbol on the stock market is AMZN. Some key tags associated with Amazon include E-commerce, Cloud Computing, Artificial Intelligence, Consumer Electronics, and Digital Distribution. Amazon's website is http://www.amazon.com and its zip code is 98109.

29044.query: I'm hosting a conference and I want to provide attendees with a digital program. Can you generate a QR code with the event schedule and speaker information? Additionally, fetch the pending messages from my TrumpetBox Cloud account to check for any last-minute changes requested by speakers. Lastly, gather the details of the specific device '24680' in my TrumpetBox Cloud account.

available_tools.name: v1_qrcode_for_qr_code_by_api_ninjas
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "qr_code_by_api_ninjas", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "API Ninjas QR Code API endpoint. Returns a QRCode image binary specified by input parameters."

data.description: data to encode in the QR code.

format.description: image format to return. Must be one of the following: png, jpg, jpeg, eps, svg.

size.description: size of the QR code image to generate. The output will be a square image with (size x size) dimensions.

To provide attendees with a digital program, you can follow these steps:

1. Create an event schedule by gathering all the necessary information about the conference sessions, including the date, time, session name, and description. Store this information in a structured format like a database or a spreadsheet.

2. Collect the details of all the speakers participating in the conference, such as their names, biographies, and contact information. Store this information in a structured format as well.

3. Use a QR code generation tool or library to generate a QR code. Input the desired data, including the event schedule and speaker information, into the QR code.

4. Merge the event schedule and speaker information into a single document or data structure. Link the speaker information to the respective sessions in the event schedule.

5. Place the generated QR code in the document or data structure created in the previous step. This will allow conference attendees to easily access the event schedule and speaker information by scanning the QR code.

To fetch pending messages from your TrumpetBox Cloud account and check for any last-minute changes requested by speakers, integrate the TrumpetBox API into your system. This API allows you to retrieve messages and handle any modifications or updates requested by the speakers. The API response contains an observation field with encoded image data, which you may need to decode and process accordingly.

To gather the details of the specific device '24680' in your TrumpetBox Cloud account, use the 'TrumpetBox Cloud:Devices-GetASingleDeviceInfoFromAccount' tool. Provide the '24680' as the 'is_id' and a valid 'key' for authentication. This tool will retrieve information about the specified device, such as its current status (online/offline), last known active timestamp, geolocation, assigned model number, firmware version, and any other relevant metadata. This information is important for ensuring that the device is operational, secure, and effectively delivering text messages to the target audience.

answer.final_answer:
For your scuba diving vacation in Thailand, I recommend the following dive sites: 
1. "The Rock" located in Racha Noi Island, Phuket. It is in the Indian Ocean, Andaman Sea, and Strait Of Malacca. 
2. "Paradise Reef" which is in Phuket, Southern Thailand. It is also in the Indian Ocean, Andaman Sea, and Strait Of Malacca.
3. "Shark Fin Reef" in Payang Island, Similan Islands, in the Indian Ocean and Andaman Sea.
4. "Bang Bao Reef" located in Kut Island, Trat which is in the Pacific Ocean, South China Sea, and Gulf Of Thailand.
5. "Nongasem" in Koh Phi Phi, Krabi.

These are just a few recommendations, but there are many more dive sites to explore in Thailand.

For top-tier accommodations near these dive sites, you can consider staying at:
1. "The Rock" in Racha Noi Island, Phuket.
2. "Paradise Reef" in Phuket, Southern Thailand.
3. "Shark Fin Reef" in Payang Island, Similan Islands.
4. "Bang Bao Reef" in Kut Island, Trat.
5. "Nongasem" in Koh Phi Phi, Krabi.
6. "Snapper Alley" in Bangu Island, Similan Islands.

These accommodations are in different regions of Thailand and offer different diving experiences.

answer.final_answer:
Sure! Here are some cocktail recipes that contain vodka as one of the ingredients:
1. Long Island Iced Tea: It includes vodka, tequila, white rum, Cointreau, gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and is topped with cola. To make it, add all the ingredients into a highball glass filled with ice, stir gently, and optionally garnish with a lemon slice. 
2. Salty Dog: This cocktail recipe consists of vodka and grapefruit juice. Shake the vodka and grapefruit juice in a cocktail shaker, and then strain it into a salt-rimmed highball glass. 
3. Vesper Martini: This cocktail recipe contains gin, vodka, and Lillet Blanc. Pour all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes, shake, and strain it into a chilled cocktail glass. 
4. Blue Hawaii: The ingredients for this cocktail include light rum, vodka, Blue Curacao, pineapple juice, and sour mix. Combine all the ingredients with ice, stir or shake, then pour it into a hurricane glass with ice. Garnish with a pineapple or orange slice, a maraschino cherry, or a cocktail umbrella. 
5. Brass Monkey: This cocktail recipe calls for dark rum, vodka, and orange juice. Stir all the ingredients together and serve it over ice. 
6. Ginza Mary: This cocktail includes vodka, tomato juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco sauce, celery salt, and black pepper. Pour all the ingredients into a highball glass and garnish as desired. 
7. Adios Motherfucker: This cocktail recipe is the same as the Long Island Iced Tea, with the addition of white rum. It contains vodka, tequila, white rum, Cointreau, gin, lemon juice, simple syrup, and is topped with cola. The instructions are the same as the Long Island Iced Tea.
 
As for the cake recipe from The Birthday Cake DB, you can choose from several options such as the classic Chocolate Truffle Cake, vibrant Rainbow Layer Cake, subtle Lemon Drizzle Cake, or traditional Rich Fruit Cake. To fetch a specific cake recipe, please provide the unique ID of the desired cake.

answer.final_answer:
For the surprise birthday party, I suggest considering "Star Wars Battlefront II: Celebration Edition" and "ABZU" as epic free games that you can play during the party. "Star Wars Battlefront II: Celebration Edition" is a popular Star Wars game with an endless journey that can be enjoyed by everyone. It has an original price of $39.99 but is currently available for free. "ABZU" is a beautiful underwater adventure game with stunning graphics and a dream-like diving experience. It has an original price of $19.99 but is also available for free. You can find more information and download these games from the Epic Games store using the provided links.

As for giveaways related to gaming, you can include "Star Wars Battlefront II: Celebration Edition" and "ABZU" as gifts for your guests. Both games are available for free and could make great gifts for gaming enthusiasts.

Regarding recent matchmaking matches in Trackmania for a competitive element, unfortunately, the API response did not provide any information about recent matchmaking matches in Trackmania. Instead, it provided information about the two free games mentioned earlier. So, I don't have specific recent matchmaking match details for Trackmania, but you can still enjoy the competitive element by playing the suggested games.

answer.final_answer:
Certainly! Here is a list of Diablo 4 gameplays related to the druid topic:

1. In-depth guides highlighting the unique abilities of the druid class, such as shapeshifting and elemental magic.
2. Gameplays showcasing the most effective druid builds for tackling the game's toughest challenges.
3. Solo gameplay videos featuring the druid class, showcasing skill synergies and item combinations.
4. Party gameplay videos with the druid class, demonstrating effective strategies and group dynamics.
5. Community-generated content that focuses specifically on the druid class in Diablo 4, offering insights, tips, and discussions.

Additionally, let me provide you with information about DAX functions used in Power BI:

Power BI utilizes a range of DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) functions for calculations, data manipulation, and managing relationships. Some commonly used DAX functions in Power BI include ADDCOLUMNS, CALCULATE, DATEADD, EOMONTH, FILTER, RELATED, SUM, and USERELATIONSHIP.

The ADDCOLUMNS function allows you to add new columns with formula results, while CALCULATE enables the modification of filter context for dynamic calculations. DATEADD performs date arithmetic, and EOMONTH gives the last day of the month for a given date. FILTER is used to apply specific conditions to data, and RELATED helps establish relationships between tables. SUM calculates the total of a specific column or measure, and USERELATIONSHIP defines custom relationships between tables.

These are just a few examples of the many DAX functions available in Power BI, each serving a specific purpose with its own syntax. These functions offer flexibility in data analysis and reporting in various scenarios, making Power BI a powerful tool for data analysis and visualization.

This tool provides information about the closest coordinates, primary swell wave direction, tide direction, tide height, tide state, valid time, wave period, wave significant height, wind direction, and wind speed. By using this tool, the agent can retrieve the relevant ocean conditions at the wedding venue for the user.

Additionally, the current phase and illumination of the moon during the wedding can be checked using the Weather:Ouranos:Moon Information tool. This tool provides data on the moon's phase, such as New Moon, First Quarter, Full Moon, or Last Quarter, as well as the moon's illumination percentage. This information can be useful for planning observations, photography, and understanding the moon's influence on various earthly phenomena during the wedding.

To summarize, the agent can provide the user with the ocean conditions closest to the wedding venue by using the Weather:Wavebase:Ocean Conditions tool. Furthermore, the agent can also provide information about the current phase and illumination of the moon during the wedding by utilizing the Weather:Ouranos:Moon Information tool.

answer.final_answer:
To visualize different landscapes for your book, I have fetched the picture of the day from the Astronomy Picture of the Day API. The picture is called "The Helix Nebula" and it is a large planetary nebula located in the constellation Aquarius. The image, taken by the Hubble Space Telescope, reveals remarkable details of the nebula's complex structure. The Helix Nebula is about 650 light-years away from Earth and is formed by a star shedding its outer layers during its final stages of evolution. The intricate patterns in the image are the result of the interplay between the outgoing gas and the radiation from the star. This picture can provide inspiration for different landscapes in your book.

In addition, I have also provided some interesting facts about the universe that you can incorporate into your story. The Helix Nebula, as mentioned earlier, is a large planetary nebula located in the constellation Aquarius. It is about 650 light-years away from Earth and is formed by a star shedding its outer layers during the final stages of its evolution. The intricate patterns seen in the image are the result of the interaction between the outgoing gas and the radiation from the star. This phenomenon provides a glimpse into the future of our own solar system, as our Sun is expected to undergo a similar transformation in about five billion years. Incorporating these facts into your story can add depth and authenticity to your universe.

answer.final_answer:
Based on the previous subtasks and their execution results, here is the response to the original question:

To organize your documents and files, you can use the following functions provided by the GroupDocs.Annotation Cloud tool:

1. To fetch the list of available files from your cloud storage, you can use the 'GetFilesList' API. This API retrieves a list of files from the specified directory path in your cloud storage. For example, by providing the input path '/folder', the API will return an array containing the names, sizes, and types of files present within that folder. This will facilitate easy management and selection of documents for annotation purposes.

2. To provide disk usage details, you can also use the 'GetFilesList' API. By providing the input path '/folder', the API will return an array that contains the names, sizes, and types of files present in that folder. This will help you easily manage and select documents for annotation purposes.

3. To check if a specific file exists in the storage, you can use the 'ObjectExists' API. This API function verifies the presence of a specified file within the storage. By providing the file path '/file.ext' to the API, it will process the request and determine if the file exists at the specified location. If the file is found, the API will return a positive confirmation indicating the existence of the file. If the file is not located, an appropriate message indicating the absence of the file will be the response. This check ensures that subsequent operations like comparing documents are only initiated when the necessary files are present to avoid errors.

By utilizing these functions, you will be able to effectively organize your documents and files, retrieve the list of files, get disk usage details, and check the existence of specific files in your cloud storage.

answer.final_answer:
Based on the given subtask results, we can recommend three stretching exercises that specifically target the hamstrings:
1. Barbell Deadlift: Approach the bar with feet hip-width apart, grip the bar at shoulder-width, and bend at the hips to lower your hips and flex the knees until your shins contact the bar. Keep your chest up and back arched as you drive through the heels to lift the weight upward. Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guide it to the floor.
2. Romanian Deadlift With Dumbbells: Start in a standing position with a dumbbell in each hand. Push your butt as far back as possible, generating tension in your hamstrings as your hands approach knee level. Maintain an arch in your back throughout the exercise. Return to the starting position by extending the hips.
3. Clean Deadlift: This exercise is specifically for Olympic weightlifting. It involves using a barbell and following similar instructions as the Barbell Deadlift. However, more details about the exercise are unavailable in the API response.

It is important to note that there may be more exercises available, but the given API response only provided details for these three stretching exercises targeting the hamstrings.

Regarding the optimal distribution of macronutrients based on activity level, body composition goals, and dietary preferences, the API response mentions that it will provide guidance on macronutrient distribution. However, the specific guidance on macronutrient distribution is not included in the given response. To obtain the optimal distribution of macronutrients, it is recommended to use the API's 'Exercises' endpoint which provides stretching exercise recommendations, and check if it also provides guidance on macronutrient distribution based on the provided parameters.

This seamless integration eliminates the need for manual calendar entries, enhancing the user experience by providing a streamlined approach to event management and participation."}

37074.query: I'm organizing a company retreat in a remote location and I need to find a suitable venue. Can you help me locate an area with breathtaking natural landscapes and good accessibility? Additionally, provide me with the Terrain RGB and Hillshading tiles for the selected location to assess the topography.

available_tools.name: balance_for_locationiq
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "locationiq", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The Balance API provides a count of request credits left in the user's account for the day. Balance is reset at midnight UTC everyday (00:00 UTC)."

available_tools.name: reverse_for_locationiq
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "locationiq", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Reverse geocoding is the process of converting a coordinate or location (latitude, longitude) to a readable address or place name. This permits the identification of nearby street addresses, places, and/or area subdivisions such as a neighborhood, county, "

normalizecity.description: Normalizes village to city level data to city

lat.description: Latitude of the location to generate an address for.

format.description: Format to geocode. Only JSON supported for SDKs

lon.description: Longitude of the location to generate an address for.

addressdetails.description: Include a breakdown of the address into elements. Defaults to 1.

accept_language.description: Preferred language order for showing search results, overrides the value specified in the Accept-Language HTTP header. Defaults to en. To use native language for the response when available, use accept-language=native

postaladdress.description: Returns address inside the postaladdress key, that is specifically formatted for each country. Currently supported for addresses in Germany. Defaults to 0 [0,1]

namedetails.description: Include a list of alternative names in the results. These may include language variants, references, operator and brand.

showdistance.description: Returns the straight line distance (meters) between the input location and the result's location. Value is set in the distance key of the response. Defaults to 0 [0,1]

statecode.description: Adds state or province code when available to the statecode key inside the address element. Currently supported for addresses in the USA, Canada and Australia. Defaults to 0

extratags.description: Include additional information in the result if available, e.g. wikipedia link, opening hours.

available_tools.name: nearest_for_locationiq
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "locationiq", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Snaps a coordinate to the street network and returns the nearest n matches. Where coordinates only supports a single {longitude},{latitude} entry."

coordinates.description: String of format {longitude},{latitude};{longitude},{latitude}[;{longitude},{latitude} ...] or polyline({polyline}) or polyline6({polyline6}). polyline follows Google's polyline format with precision 5

exclude.description: Additive list of classes to avoid, order does not matter. input Value - {class}[,{class}] Format - A class name determined by the profile or none.

number.description: Number of nearest segments that should be returned. [ integer >= 1 (default 1) ]

bearings.description:
Limits the search to segments with given bearing in degrees towards true north in clockwise direction. List of positive integer pairs separated by semi-colon and bearings array should be equal to length of coordinate array.
Input Value :- {bearing};{bearin

generate_hints.description: Adds a Hint to the response which can be used in subsequent requests, see hints parameter. Input Value - true (default), false Format - Base64 String

approaches.description: Keep waypoints on curb side. Input Value - {approach};{approach}[;{approach} ...] Format - curb or unrestricted (default)

radiuses.description: Limits the search to given radius in meters Radiuses array length should be same as coordinates array, eaach value separated by semi-colon. Input Value - {radius};{radius}[;{radius} ...] Radius has following format :- double >= 0 or unlimited (default)

available_tools.name: lookup_coordinates_for_reverse_geocode_locator_u_s
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "reverse_geocode_locator_u_s", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Convert US latitude and longitude coordinates into local city information"

available_tools.name: walk_score_for_walk_score
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "walk_score", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get walk_score_for_walk_score"

lat.description: The latitude of the requested location.

lon.description: The longitude of the requested location.

format.description: Type of result to return: (movie, series, episode)

bike.description: Set bike=1 to request Bike Score (if available).

transit.description: Set transit=1 to request Transit Score (if available).

I apologize for the inconvenience, but I encountered an issue while trying to locate an area with breathtaking natural landscapes and good accessibility for your company retreat. The coordinates I received correspond to a location called "Null Island" in the Atlantic Ocean, which is not a real place. Therefore, I cannot provide specific information about such an area.

Furthermore, due to the error retrieving the Terrain RGB and Hillshading tiles, I am unable to assess the topography of the selected location. I apologize for any inconvenience caused.

message.response: {"error": "", "response": "The received coordinates with latitude 0 and longitude 0 refer to a location known as 'Null Island,' which is at the intersection of the equator and the prime meridian in the Atlantic Ocean. This location is often used as a placeholder in mapping systems as it is not a real inhabited place. No actual forward or reverse geocoding information can be provided for this location, as it does not correspond to a genuine address or point of interest. In a typical use case for a geocoding API with valid coordinates, the response would include detailed location data such as a street address, city, country, postal code, and other relevant information."}

It is mentioned that there have been consistent failures in connecting to the host in previous API call examples, so retrieving the certificate details might encounter issues. It is recommended to ensure proper connectivity and permissions for retrieving SSL certificate details, which typically include the certificate issuer, the date of issuance, expiration date, and the encryption methods supported.

answer.final_answer:
To gather information about the latest news articles related to a specific topic and get a comprehensive view of the topic, you can follow these steps:

1. Use the Get DM Conversation API to fetch the DM conversation related to the specific topic. Refer to the previously mentioned steps for fetching DM conversations.
2. After extracting the DM conversation data, analyze it to identify any news articles or relevant information related to the specific topic.
3. If there are any news articles mentioned in the DM conversation, retrieve the necessary details such as article title, source, and publication date.
4. Additionally, use the Reddit API to retrieve the top posts by a specific user related to the topic. Refer to the previously mentioned steps for fetching posts by a specific user.
5. Process the response from the Reddit API to extract the necessary information from the top posts, such as post title, upvotes, and comments.
6. Combine the information from the DM conversation and the top posts to get a comprehensive view of the topic, including the latest news articles and popular discussions on Reddit.

By following these steps, you will be able to gather information about the latest news articles related to a specific topic and also get insights from top posts on Reddit, providing a comprehensive view of the topic.

answer.final_answer:
Based on the previous subtasks and their execution results, I can provide you with a resume and cover letter. The resume will include your full name, address, phone number, email, objective statement, educational background, skills, work experience, and personal projects. The objective statement will highlight your degree in Information Systems from Michigan State University and your skills in networking and web development. The education section will mention your bachelor's degree from Michigan State University, and the skills section will detail your proficiency in full stack web development, strong understanding of networking principles, and experience with the LEMP stack. The work experience section will list your previous role as a Full Stack Web Developer at a company, and the personal projects section will describe a custom web application you developed using the LEMP stack.

Regarding your interest in exploring remote job opportunities, I can provide you with the latest remote jobs available. The roles include positions such as Frontend Developer, Backend Developer, Product Designer, Customer Success Representative, Data Analyst, and DevOps Engineer at Shopify. Each job entry will provide the role's title, a brief description, the date the job was listed, and a direct link to the Shopify careers page for more information or to apply. It is important to apply promptly and ensure you meet the specified qualifications and experience for each job listing.

If you provide me with the ID of a specific job, I can retrieve detailed information about that job for you. The information will include the job title, company, description, requirements, salary range, location, type, and an application link.

Additionally, I can provide you with an updated list of the latest remote job openings at Shopify. The roles include positions such as Frontend Developer, Backend Developer, Product Designer, Customer Success Representative, Data Analyst, and DevOps Engineer. Each job entry will contain the role's title, a brief description, the date the job was listed, and a direct link to the Shopify careers page to apply or find out more details. It is recommended to apply promptly and make sure you adequately match the specified qualifications and experience.

34437.query: I'm a web developer and I'm looking for inspiration for my new project. Can you suggest some trending GIFs and stickers related to coding and technology? Additionally, provide me with a tool to capture screenshots of websites with modern and innovative designs.

This results are split up in result pages. By using the p and ps parameters you can fetch more results. All of the other parameters are identical to the search "

q.description: The search terms that need to occur in one of the fields of the artwork data

culture.description: nl / en		The language to search in (and of the results)

The translate API draws on search, but uses the Giphy "special sauce" to handle translating from one vocabulary to another. In this case, words and phrases to GIFs. Use a"

s.description: term or phrase to translate into a GIF

rating.description: limit results to those rated (y,g, pg, pg-13 or r).

available_tools.name: trending_gifs_for_giphy
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "giphy", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Fetch GIFs currently trending online. The data returned mirrors that used to create The Hot 100 list of GIFs on Giphy. Returns 25 results by default."

available_tools.name: sticker_trending_for_giphy
available_tools.description: This is the subfunction for tool "giphy", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Get the latest stickers trending on Giphy with this endpoint."

s.description: term or phrase to translate into a GIF
